alert.note: Alert for Baboquivari Mountains including Kitt Peak; Tohono O'odham Nation including Sells; Upper Santa Cruz River and Altar Valleys including Nogales; Western Pima County Including Ajo, Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 2:07PM MST until August 17 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: .Moisture moving north in advance of Hurricane Hilary is expected to enhance the potential for heavy rainfall producing showers and thunderstorms for areas south and west of Tucson Saturday afternoon through Saturday night. Multiple storms with heavy rainfall moving over the same location is also a possibility increasing the threat of heavy runoff and flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following areas, Baboquivari Mountains, Tohono O`odham Nation, Upper Santa Cruz River Valley/Altar Valley and Western Pima County. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Storms could produce very heavy short duration rainfall resulting in local Flash Flooding (rapid rises) while repetitive rains over a larger area could also result in significant rises in slower responding water ways such as the Vamori Wash. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Baboquivari Mountains including Kitt Peak; Tohono O'odham Nation including Sells; Upper Santa Cruz River and Altar Valleys including Nogales; Western Pima County Including Ajo, Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument
